intro: Oreogrammitis rupicola, commonly known as the rock fern, is a species of fern that thrives in rocky and coastal environments. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant typically has dark green, leathery fronds with a serrated or lobed margin. It is often found in moist, shaded areas on cliffs, walls, or among rocks. Oreogrammitis rupicola is well adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
